sentence.Network_en: There is a pressing need to modernise our electoral system.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的选举制度迫切需要现代化。

sentence.Network_en: The electoral fortunes of the Liberal Democratic party may decline.
sentence.Network_cn: 自由民主党的选举运势可能会下降。

sentence.Network_en: The Mongolian Democratic Party is campaigning for electoral reform.
sentence.Network_cn: 蒙古民主党正发起运动争取选举改革。

entry.def: Electoral is used to describe things that are connected with elections.

意大利比例代表制的选举体制

sentences.en: Japan’s electoral system of multi-member constituencies
sentences.cn: 日本实行的多议席选区的选举体制

sentences.en: It is difficult to reach a consensus about electoral reform.
sentences.cn: 要就选举改革达成共识很困难。

sentences.en: It is undemocratic to govern an area without an electoral mandate.
sentences.cn: 没有选民授权就统辖一个地区是不民主的。
